Fields.DialogueText: So, Captain...
Not a happy look in your eye. What did I do?
Nothing! I just wanted to discuss the name everyone calls me... Goldie.
I know it was bothering you.
I'm trying not to let it affect me, but the crew seems to really like using it... so for the sake of their morale...

Fields.MenuText: I do salute your generosity.
That's good to hear. Honestly, it suits you - and in a good way. Own it!
Your morale matters too, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain!
You're right, Captain!
True... but theirs comes first.
Is there anything I can help with? I mean... if there is anything I can help with.
Just needed to get it off my chest, Captain. Thanks. I appreciate you being there for me... truly...
Where else would I be?
Of course I do!
Oh. Yeah, no worries on that front.
Time to get a move on, Captain!
Right...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ughhh... I'm doing my best.
But... I'm glad it makes a difference. Honestly, it's flattering that you care about my opinion outside of the day-to-day.
I care about the opinion of everyone on this ship! Besides, it doesn't hurt to be on the captain's good side, right?
Ah! Slow down! You just nicked the side, Ensign! Didn't you see the signs all over this ship?
I'm sorry, ma'am!
You'll be sorry, all right, if that explodes!

Fields.MenuText: What in the heck just happened?
Were we hit? No one notified me of any Morganas!
Somers! Somebody... report, immediately!

Fields.DialogueText: One of our ensigns just dropped - and wasted, might I add - a bomb! Got us right in the side... and that wave sure didn't help either.
The explosion and the giant wave that rocked us, Captain? This ensign here let a bomb slip through their fingers.
Aye, Captain! The wave and explosion that hit us was caused by this ensign dropping a bomb over the side.
Captain! It was an accident, I swear!
You know the rules, and you know how Somers feels about them. You need to be CAREFUL with these explosives. You're lucky I don't have someone dishonorably discharge you for this.
Aye, Captain...
Toothbrush scrub duty?
Right after I have a full incident report written up and on my desk.
Aye, Captain.
Dismissed!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Now that our ensign is sorted out, we can sort out these Morganas next. Battle stations!
I've been in touch with some of my fellow Belles, Captain.
How are they doing?
Some better than others. A few have reported difficulty after interaction with the Morganas - a strange mental "pull" is how many of them describe it.

Fields.MenuText: Do they need supplies? Medical aid?
I know you're close to many of them. That mist is something else, isn't it?
Perhaps we'll meet a few at the next port? It might be good to socialize a bit and relax.

Fields.DialogueText: They are resourceful, but I appreciate your concern.
And no one has figured out how the Morganas work with it... If they have any insight to share, I'll let you know, Captain.
I know we can't necessarily count on that. Until then, our letters are enough.
Nautilus has always been one of your closest friends, right?
Aye, Captain! We share a connection, historically. My namesake, Richard Somers, had command of a schooner with her name.
A schooner, not a submarine... but I guess it still counts.
That's exactly what I said. But - uh oh.
What is it?
I'm sensing a few Morganas straight ahead, Captain. Let's get everyone to battle stations, and quickly!
@BATTLE
"I do appreciate the lovely poem, yet I must sincerely apologize - for I cannot reciprocate your feelings. But do know that your poem rests beside my favorite book..."
What the heck is that all about?
Another... what was it you said, "adoring fan?" They did wrote me a beautiful poem, but...
I get it, letting them down easy?
Exactly. Though they did give me an excellent idea for another section.

Fields.MenuText: Would you ever reciprocate? Is there anyone else on your mind?
So what are your thoughts on relationships anyway?
So that poem... can I read it?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not going to tell you! A gal has to keep a few mysteries.
I *love* love! Why do you think I love the French Rivera so much? It's just so... romantic. I'd love to go with a sweetie of mine...
Of course not! It's private, Captain. I respect my dears enough to keep matters like these intimate, and for our eyes only.
I can understand that.
Why do you ask?
No reason! Just, ah... wanting to get to know you - and the crew - more. Walking around... asking everyone fun questions about themselves...
How kind of you to do that, Captain! A little face to face time with you really cheers them up!
Yep. You got it right on the nose, Somers.
@BATTLE
Love letters?!
Ha! No no no... Maybe we could have civilians send us their poems, and have them featured in the paper for the crew to read.
*ALARM*
Thank you for inviting me to dinner, Somers. It smells amazing!
Of course, Captain. I can't wait until you try these recipe. One of the Belles sent it my way after I sent her a copy of a recent edition of the ship's newspaper.
What are we having?
A nice meat pie. I made the crust extra buttery and flaky.
Also, these candles give this place a nice touch.
I thought it would set the mood better.
You can say that again.
How about some wine? I've been meaning to open this bottle for awhile now.
Oh? Good idea. How about a toast? To, hmm... whatever the future brings us?
Sorry I'm late, Somers! This looks great, by the way!
Captain, are you all right? It looks like something disagreed with you.
Just peachy.
Uhm... Captain?
How about that toast? Have some wine, Waynes!
To... whatever else the future brings us, I suppose.
Cheers!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I thought it would set the mood better.
Okay. Yes, I literally asked for that.
Hey, Somers.
If you have a minute, I've been meaning to ask...
Yes, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: I see you sometimes, when you aren't looking... there's a sadness behind your eyes. Is everything all right?
If there's anything you need to talk about, you know you can tell me. Right?
Thinking too much about the war? It's hard to avoid, I'll admit.

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly, I'm not sure... It feels like... I'm yearning for something.
Yes, Captain. It's just that... I don't know, but I feel like...
I know. I have this heavy feeling in my chest, and it's so strong! It's like...
Like something's missing?
That's exactly it. But, I don't know what I'm missing...
I understand how you feel. I'm missing something too, but I know it'll come back around.
Hm...that's a nice thought, Captain. I'll keep that in mind.
I hope you find it one day.
The moment I do, I'll let you know.
Hey... hey do you see that? Take a look through these binoculars.
No, I just sensed it. I think it just unveiled itself. It may have been tailing us for awhile.
Better safe than sorry. Get the crew to battle stations, Somers.
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Say, Somers...
Yes?
Have you finished that book I gave you?
Oh yes! More than once. I cherish it so much. It remains on a special area on my desk.
Oh yeah? That's... that's great!
It's possibly one of my most highly prized possessions.

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad.
Among the wines and jewels? Consider me shocked!
That's great! Wow, um... is it getting hot in here?

Fields.DialogueText: It's the most thoughtful gift I've ever received!
Oh, stop teasing, you! I love it!
Captain! You're sweating, are you all right? Here, take a napkin.
Maybe I can borrow the book sometime?
Heavens, no! Are you batty?
Wait, what?
Excuse me, Captain. What I meant was, I'll let you borrow a different copy. This one never leaves its spot.
Huh. Well at least I know you're taking care of it...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Keeping the screws at a lower speed, Captain. Maybe we can keep the torque higher that way.
Great minds, Somers. I was thinking the same thing. Let's keep these waves from pushing us around too much.
Hopefully with minimal damage. I've read a few reports from other Belles that the Morganas have been moving around to avoid rough seas like this.

Fields.MenuText: Perfect, if you ask me. I'd rather not deal with any of them during this.
Excellent. When the storm has passed, we'll move to flank whomever's closest.
Just goes to show how tough we are, eh?

Fields.DialogueText: I wholeheartedly agree. We have enough supplies to ride out the storm, but docking is the number one priority afterwards.
Good. Our hull is tough enough. Once the storm passes, we'll have good hunting.
We're toughing this out and riding it through, Captain!
Uh-oh...
Is that a...
She's close! Brace for impact!
*ALARM*
Was that on purpose? Maybe she didn't see us until she was right on top of us...
She'll come around again, probably with her friends. Get us to battle stations!
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Phew! Well, that was fun.
You can say that again! Wait... don't.
You know me too well, Captain.
Maybe we're getting better at reading each other. Almost like a private language.
I've been thinking about the Allies' spy ring, which had me wondering about ways we could safely pass information to one another.
Keep the ideas coming, Somers.
Well, I'm not entirely optimistic. Secure communication takes more than just--

Fields.MenuText: --than just hoping the other person reads your mind?
--than just trying to finish each other's sentences?
--than just what?

Fields.DialogueText: That sort of communication might be secure, but not exactly reliable.
Ha! Maybe you're on to something!
Not sure. I lost my train of thought. That's rare, if I'm being candid.
Maybe we should've joined the Signal Corps. What do you think?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
The way my soul responds to that alarm, and the thought of combat at sea tells me I belong right where I am, Captain.
I'm with you.
Didn't you just love the mud baths at the spa, Johnson?
Sure did, Goldie. Didn't know how much I've been missing out!
I see you two had a grand time at port?
Aye, Captain. Remind me to go with Goldie next time. She really knows all the hot spots!
It's wonderful to be able to report on some of them in person.
That it is. Johnson, sorry to burst your bubble but I need that report on my desk sooner rather than later.
Aye, Captain! I'll get it wrapped up. Until next time, Goldie!
Oohhh, Captain. Sometimes you're no fun!

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean? R & R is over, you know.
Me? No fun? We have a lot of fun together, Somers.
I'm great fun! But it's important to remind everyone that we still have a service to do.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose... but you didn't have to dismiss them so suddenly. It made you look.. ah, never mind.
Yes, we do. We all do! As a matter of fact, we should throw a party.
I suppose I can agree with that.
*ALARM*
I swear the Morganas just know the worst possible times to come along...
Do they ever.
@BATTLE
Believe me, my sisters and I have put a lot of effort into researching ports with attractions we can actually visit.
*ALARM*
I'm here. What are we looking at?
A few wake patterns. Something's come through here lately.
Must be close. Keep your eyes peeled, because we'll be in a gunfight soon. Good work, Somers.
Observant and decisive, Captain!
@BATTLE
I don't think I've ever seen a Morgana run along home so quickly after she was licked.
I agree, Captain. They ran out of there faster than a chicken on a hog on a flapjack!
Like a what?!
Just something I picked up from a book I borrowed from one of the crewmen. I just can't put it down!

Fields.MenuText: So is the book filled with nothing but those... sayings? What it even about?
I've been wondering what everyone was saying around here. I thought everyone got the Morgana sickness! That makes a lot of sense now.
I don't think that makes any sense at all.

Fields.DialogueText: Darn tootin'! It's about a farmer suffering through a heatwave and drought! Though I do say, the prose is a bit... quaint.
It's a real humdinger, it is!
It's literature. You can interpret it however you'd like!
I think you should write a section of that for the next paper!
Great idea, Captain! I'll--
Hey! Midshipman! Stay in the required smoking areas! See you in a few, Captain!
Yeah... the new recruits are sure in for a mouthful.
I heard that!
Hey, Somers, uhm...
Since you couldn't go all the way into town the last time we made port, I... I got you these flowers.
Oh, these are nice! What for, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Just because?
I think they'll look nice in your quarters.
UmtheylookedprettyandIthoughtofyou. Ahem.

Fields.DialogueText: Just because of what? Are you well, Captain? You look a bit pale.
How nice of you, Captain!
I'm sorry, what? I didn't catch that.
I think they're beautiful, Captain, even if the aroma is a bit strong.
Really? Oh. Maybe I can find something to do with them...
Wait! I can place them by the porthole. Give them some light, yes? They'll look lovely there.
*ALARM*
And I'm "saved" by the Morganas again...
What was that, Captain?
Nothing! Let's get moving!
@BATTLE
Morganas on our tails, Captain!
What? Somers! Report! Why are we just finding this out?
I don't know, Captain. Radar never detected any... Did they jam our radar?
Damn. Battle stations!
Guns are ready, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: They just have a way to jam radar now.
Our lookouts should have spotted the Morganas sooner.
Why didn't you sense them sooner, Somers?

Fields.DialogueText: Or we're behind on maintenance, Captain. Don't rule that out.
If they were sleeping on duty, I'll get to the bottom of it. After the combat, of course.
I may have been distracted, Captain. Sorry.
No use crying about it. We're in a fight, and we'll win it.
Here they come, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Oh, hell.
They're just not letting up, are they?
@BATTLE
I want full damage reports and updates on our wounded.
Aye, Captain!
Somers, report!
Somers? Where are you?

Fields.MenuText: Somers? We may have taken a bad hit or two. Are you all right?
No time for the silent treatment, Somers.
Goldie? Can you hear me?

Fields.DialogueText: Cap...tain...?
Captain... I'd complain if... if I had the... energy...
Not sure what rung your chimes like that, Somers, but I'm sure that damage control is on the case. Just try to relax.
It could've... been bad luck. Oof... I think... I think I... I should rest.
I'll send the doc your way in a few minutes. Just glad you're okay.
Need help getting to your quarters?
I'll be fine. My head is clearing a bit already, but I should still lie down for a moment.
I will be.
Before she kicked me out, I did manage a look.
How's our Belle looking? Was she resting?
She was sitting down and sipping some coffee. She took the reports you had me deliver, and sent me on my way.
Thanks. I'll be sure to recommend you for a job as a field reconnaissance agent if you want.

Fields.MenuText: I need Somers here. Her insight would be extremely helpful right about now.
I hope she's on her feet soon. I miss her.
She's fine. She's a destroyer. A Grade-A Belle. She'll be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Ready for anything, Captain. Just needed a rest.
I'm touched, Captain... No need to worry about me. I'm ready to work.
You're right about that, Captain.
Somers! I thought I told you to rest.
The Morganas got a lucky shot in somewhere, but I've got a clear head again.
Ready for more, then?
Aye. And before you ask me again, I wouldn't claim to be okay if it weren't true. I wouldn't put the crew at risk like that.
I'm convinced. Besides, it will rally the crew to see you back in the thick of it!
They need to see their Goldie, don't they? Ha!
@BATTLE
Ha! Any time, Captain. Hope our Goldie gets well soon.
And I did. Thanks for the mandatory R&R, Captain.
*ALARM*
Yeah. That's a battleship group, all right.
Captain, uhm... I don't know that we could outrun them even if I tried.
Yeah. But you--
I told you that I'm fine, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: You did give us a scare not long ago.
Okay, Somers. I get it.
Maybe you should get more rest, just in case.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate your concern, truly - but we need to get on with the war.
I'm sorry, but I'll ask you to please stop doubting me. I can handle this.
I have, Captain. If a lady tells you she's ready, she is.
Got it. I won't question you again.
*ALARM*
Somers, let's go.
Aye aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
So what do you think, Somers? If you want to make a tactical withdrawal, this is the time.
Orders, Captain?
Get this deck cleared and swab it down. I'll be happy to see us looking clean again.
Aye, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: A conquering hero?
A captain that cleans up after a party?
A captain that reaches for a stiff drink after a near-death experience?

Fields.DialogueText: Everybody loves a winner.
A clean uniform, a clean deck... all signs of a disciplined soul.
You're not wrong!
Thanks for the compliment, Somers.
How about you? Morganas didn't knock anything loose, did they?
*ALARM*
Not yet, but I suppose they get another chance today!
@BATTLE
Ah, a captain after my own heart.
That's not funny, Somers.
I said they get a chance... which I'd rate as "slim, indeed" if I'm being realistic!
Come in!
Just a health and habitability inspection of your quarters, Somers. Everything in order?
Nice try. I know you're here to check on your Belle, not her bunk.
At least you're honest, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Why does talking about your bunk make me blush?
Bulkheads look solid, check. Cleanliness, check. Seems like this place passes inspection.
Guilty as charged, Somers.

Fields.DialogueText: Belle slightly irritated by her captain's concern? Check. Belle still happy to see her captain anyway? Check.
Ha! This bashful routine is a strange play, but you've got my attention.
The doc cleared you, and you assured me you're fine, but still...
Still what? Be still my beating heart?
It's not a rational decision for me to keep checking on you. It's just a feeling, and it's hard for me to ignore.
I understand, Captain. You're just following your heart a little bit.
Maybe we should follow our hearts a little more out here at sea.
Oh, things like that will definitely get my attention. What exactly are you trying to say, Captain?
Um... I'm not even sure why I said that...
I might fix a drink, if you don't mind. I feel like I'm about to be entertained by whatever comes out of your mouth next.
*ALARM*
Damn. Hadn't even gotten ice in my glass.
Let's go, Somers.
Aren't you going to promise me we'll pick this conversation up exactly where we left of? Captain?
@BATTLE
So we'll move along this track, towards the latest Morgana sightings. We can expect--
Ah, Somers. Good of you to join us. Just briefing on the latest intel updates from HQ.
I'm glad I showed up right on time. Sorry for interrupting.

Fields.MenuText: Hogwash. Don't worry about it.
You haven't missed much.
This might be the first time you've ever mistimed your arrival to a brief.

Fields.DialogueText: Good to hear it! Where were you?
Keep going then. I'll catch up as we go.
Nonsense. If I'm ever late, it's always fashionably so.
All right, let's continue!
Ah... Captain?
Yes, Somers?
Hmm... I spy a Morgana along our path. Possibly carrying loot.
Behold, a glimpse of the old Somers returns...
She seems heavily laden with valuable goods... er, I mean, troublesome, heavy burdens... May I?
Go for it!
All right everyone, full speed ahead! Shall we re-supply?
@BATTLE
Are you glowing, Somers? Is this something new?
Oh, what? Glowing? Oh, no! I just feel refreshed. That battle... well, I needed all of that time to recover.
I'm sure everyone has stopped by to see you.
I love spending time with all of them!

Fields.MenuText: But... you didn't forget about your dearest captain, have you?
Don't spread yourself too thin. Maybe just you and me, and whatever recipe you decide to try?
It's entertaining to see! And reading their fan letters is well... they write some stirring chatter.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Of course not!
I knew you enjoyed trying them!
It keeps the readers coming, I say! I'll have you choose the next few we add for the upcoming issue!
Okay, okay good! Let's plan a-
Goldie! I heard you were passing through here! So good to see you!
Ah. Hello, there, Marcelle.
Oh! I'm so sorry, Captain! Did I interrupt something?
Not at all, but let's catch up later, Marcelle.
*ALARM*
Heeeere we go...
Sorry, Cap!
@BATTLE
Okay, chandeliers over there!
Let's set four round tables over... there.
Yes, and please make sure to have Chancellor Bottone and Madame Arnolds seated together. Let's create some heat between the two!

Fields.MenuText: What... chandeliers? Where in the world did you get those?
Is that... is that an ice sculpture??
Chancellor Bottone and Madame Arnolds? How did you pull those strings? Did we pay for this?

Fields.DialogueText: I've borrowed them from a lovely place in England. They'll be the most elegant touch to decor.
Of course! It's the centerpiece. What else would we have there?
Well, I do know how to pull some strings here and there... Connections, you see.
And where exactly is this money coming from?
Why, me. Who else? I want to make sure we have the greatest celebration.
All right, then. Let's make sure we bolt down heavier objects just in case the waves or another battle comes and knocks it all over.
I'll have a squad of folks on it in a jiffy!
Oh, boy. Well, it is about time we've all had an opportunity to relax and mingle again. Let's give the crew something to look forward to!
Aye aye!
Spot that?
I don't have to look to catch your drift, Captain. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Welcome to the party!
An event like this almost demands a better word to capture the grandeur. The chandelier looks amazing.
And do you smell that wonderful aroma wafting in the air? We have plenty of exotic foods to try from all over the world, and the most luxurious chefs to prepare it all.
My mouth is watering just thinking about it all... but let's start off with something to drink!
Right this way, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to say... you look beautiful. It's so good to see you back to your normal self.
Wow, Somers your outfit looks spotless. You know how to catch an eye.
You always look stunning, and this is no exception.

Fields.DialogueText: Ohh Captain! Why... haha, why thank you. You're looking quite snazzy yourself!
Ah yes! Proper maintenance isn't just for engines and cannons.
Kind of you to say, Captain.
Ahem. Our bartender will take care of that, Captain.
Right, right! You're doing an excellent job. Make sure to take off some time and help yourself, too.
Thank you, Captain!
Ah! I just picked up a pack of Morganas. Of course they would try and crash our party...
Let's show 'em how we swing! The sooner we're done, the sooner we're back to having some fun!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Somers?
Just a couple of degenerate Morganas out on their own, Captain. I'd say "easy pickings," but I don't want to jinx us.
@BATTLE
Now that that's over, another hand of cards?
You betcha, Captain. I'm tired of you taking my money!
Not for me, thanks. I'll just enjoy the view from over there by the charcuterie table, thank you very much. I also had the best caviar brought in, and I won't miss that!
Uh-oh.
Accusing me of cowardice? Well, then.

Fields.MenuText: She's going to bring out the big guns... and by that I'm not entirely sure if that includes the turrets.
I'm not sure you'll be able to write that many 'IOUs' to her for that remark, Johnson.
Johnson? I think you should scoot your chair over a bit.

Fields.DialogueText: Deal the cards and find out.
Taking all of your chips would suffice!
Oh stop! I'm not going to do anything.
I got this. Let's start this thing! Jacks are wild!
Here goes nothing...
Maybe it's time to collect my winnings. I've already won this round!
Oh, yeah? I can see through your poker face!
You never know how many "plus ones" decide to turn up...
Ahh, don't cut and run now, Somers!
And that's how you beat 'em! Royal flush! It's time to pay up!
Aww, come on, Cap! You sure you aren't hiding cards? This is the third hand in a row that you've won!
Heh. Sorry, Johnson! Let's just say that I have Lady Luck on my side. Isn't that right, Somers?
Oh, a lucky lady by the Captain? Can you imagine the headline? Hm. I wonder whom she might be...
She's the most beautiful girl in my sights. The one who's been by my side the most. I suppose I'm just... waiting for the right moment.
W...what?
Drinks on me! Somers, you, too. I know a certain fine wine is calling your name.
Wait, Captain, what did you mean by that?
Ok. Somers, it's y--
Woohoo! Read 'em and weep!
Nice hand, Johnson. You wouldn't mind taking all of our chips and excusing us?
Happy to do it, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Okay you know what? Ddamn the torpedoes... Somers? I mean, Goldie... I love you.
When you got hurt, everything became clear to me. I love you, Goldie.
Time for me to show you my cards. I love you, Goldie.

Fields.DialogueText: I -
I -
I -
*ALARM*
Of all the blasted luck...
Take my hand, Captain! Let's get to the bridge...
@BATTLE
So... I've done a lot of thinking...
Hey, look, I didn't mean to put you in a spot.
I know, I know. Spirits were so lifted after that battle, and everyone had a lot to drink at the party. I understand how you must've felt.
And I apologize, Somers. I don't know what came over me!
No, no need to apologize! That's what I came in to talk to you about.

Fields.MenuText: (Maybe I've got a shot... or maybe I'm nuts...)
(Mayday! Mayday! Mayday!)
(I suppose this is where I go down with the ship...)

Fields.DialogueText: ...and then that's when it hit me.
...and that's when I realized it, and I can't hide from it anymore.
...I knew then, that what I was feeling couldn't be held back anymore.
Mm hmm... Huh?
Were you listening?
I might have been in a bit of an internal conversation, but I did hear you. Just wasn't sure if I heard you correctly.
Well, here's the headline. I'm crazy about you, too, Cap.
*ALARM*
I suppose I should have expected that. Well, are you ready, Goldie?
Always, my love.
I get admirers now and then, but you're something else.
I was hoping we were on the same page.
The front page, Cap. Now we really ought to--
